moves.3... a6: Spanish Opening Continued to the Morphy Defense.
moves.6... Bxd4: He chooses to lose the bishop.
moves.7. Qxd4: Nice position for the queen in an undeveloped center.
moves.7... Nc6 8. Qxg7 Qf6: Competent response, In his shoes I would've done the same.
moves.9. Bh6: !! This is where white gains the edge (the rook) needed to win.
moves.9... Qxh6 10. Qxh8 Qg6 11. Bxc6: Thinking back I would've rather kept my bishop for a more powerful endgame.
This pretty much forces a trade which I want to happen.
moves.16. Nc3: I begin to connect the team of rooks.
moves.17. Rad1 f5 18. Rxd8+ Kxd8: Now it's a Rook/Knight vs Bishop/Knight.
moves.19. exf5 Bxf5 20. Rd1+ Kc8 21. Rd2 b5 22: The main trick for white is making sure he cannot run any of his pawns. I should've also started running my own pawns too.
moves.32... Nc4 33. Ra8 Kb7 34. Rd8 Nxa3 35. N: Rook Sacrifice so I can nail both of his minor pieces.
Annotated by The King of Spades.
